message:
If you use a truly asynchronous file copy and await it, then the thread is not blocked. It is returned to the thread pool. A short while later, when the file copy completes, a thread is briefly borrowed from the thread pool to complete the request and send the response.  

Regarding asynchronous file streams, a quick Google search turned up this:  
 [http://blogs.msdn.com/b/csharpfaq/archive/2012/01/23/using-async-for-file-access-alan-berman.aspx](http://blogs.msdn.com/b/csharpfaq/archive/2012/01/23/using-async-for-file-access-alan-berman.aspx)  
which looks quite good.
